body:
I finally read Lonesome Dove this year and bawled my way through it, I absolutely adored it and it’s one of my top 3 all time favorite books for sure. Ever since getting into the Red Dead Redemption universe I’ve been really into westerns and Lonesome Dove was one of my father’s favorite books so I had it on my TBR pile after he passed last year.

I read the other three books in the series and definitely recommend them. Streets Of Laredo disappointed me some, but it did feel like a fitting conclusion in the way it leaves the characters behind, some with hopeful futures, some with nothing. It’s by far the saddest and darkest of the three so if you want to leave it at LD you’ll still get a decent conclusion and your heart will remain more or less intact…

If you’re up for it read Dead Man’s Walk (the first book chronologically in the story) then Comanche Moon, then Lonesome Dove, then Streets of Laredo. But if LD is still fresh in your head you can skip it and go right on to SoL.

I plan to re-read the series in a year or two. It was so stunning.
